reference.title: ICV_BPR1_EL1, Interrupt Controller Virtual Binary Point Register 1, EL1
reference.shortdesc: ICV_BPR1_EL1 defines the point at which the priority value fields split into two parts, the group priority field and the subpriority field. The group priority field determines virtual Group 1 interrupt preemption.

section.title: Bit field descriptions
section.p: ICV_BPR1_EL1 is a 32-bit register and is part of the virtual GIC system registers functional group.

dd.p: The value of this field controls how the 8-bit interrupt priority field is split into a group priority field, that determines interrupt preemption, and a subpriority field.
The minimum value that is implemented of ICV_BPR1_EL1 Secure register is 2.
The minimum value that is implemented of ICV_BPR1_EL1 Non-secure register is 3.

section.p: Bit fields and details that are not provided in this description are architecturally defined. See the Arm Generic Interrupt Controller Architecture Specification.
